definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
with an undeserved reputation (idiom); unwarranted fame/nowhere near as good as he's made out to be

sentences.english: He is poor apology for a paladin.
sentences.chinese: 他只是個徒有虛名的遊俠罷了。

sentences.english: This small"demon"not wave get hollow reputation.
sentences.chinese: 這個小“精靈”絕非浪得虛名。

sentences.english: He is a scholar of a kind.
sentences.chinese: 他是個徒有虛名的學者。

sentences.english: Not a false reputation, sarcasm disappear, do more practical work, honor.
sentences.chinese: 不圖虛名，譏諷隨之消失，多幹實事，榮譽不期而至。

sentences.english: Till love and fame to nothingness do sink.
sentences.chinese: 直到愛與虛名化爲烏有沉寂無聲。

sentences.english: The system monitor chamber is only in name.
sentences.chinese: 體制監察室徒有虛名等。

sentences.english: Mr Green is a professor in name but not in reality.
sentences.chinese: 格林先生是徒有虛名的教授。

sentences.english: Let us not be desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying one another.
sentences.chinese: 不要貪圖虛名，彼此惹氣，互相嫉妒。

sentences.english: He is a ruler without power, a mere fly on the wheel .
sentences.chinese: 他是一個沒有實權的統治者，只是徒有虛名而已。

sentences.english: Reputationisoften got without merit and lost without fault .
sentences.chinese: 浪得虛名尋常見，無過失名亦不鮮。

sentences.english: Where boist'rous joy is but a name.
sentences.chinese: 他們的歡樂不過是虛名。

sentences.english: Rather negative in name transition youth.
This new atmosphere is not lifted shares in circulation as illusory.
sentences.chinese: 這種新氣象，並非因爲解禁股流通徒有虛名。

definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
to lean against/to rely on/on the basis of/no matter (how, what etc)/proof
to engulf/to bury/to overlook/to stifle/to neglect/to fall into oblivion
to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
I would like to ask (usually used rhetorically)/one might well ask
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
